hook.text: From Hong Kong to Chile to Iran, millions have marched in recent years. Protest is the new normal.

buildup.text: Modern protests are larger, faster, and more connected than ever. Grievances spread globally in hours.

discovery.text: Between 2010 and 2020, mass protests erupted in over 100 countries. The era of mass mobilization is back.

twist.text: Most protests don't topple governments. Many are repressed, co-opted, or simply fizzle out from exhaustion.

climax.text: Successful movements combine street protest with institutional change: new parties, laws, and leaders.

punchline.text: Protests voice anger. Lasting change requires organization beyond the streets.

quiz.question: What do successful protest movements combine with street action?
options: Institutional change through new parties, laws, and leaders
Only online activity without any physical presence
